skill.name: image-generator
skill.description:
Generate professional visuals using Gemini via browser automation with 6-gate quality control.
Use when creating chapter illustrations, diagrams, or teaching visuals.
NOT for stock photos or decorative images.
skill.summary:
Generate professional visuals using Gemini via browser automation with 6-gate quality control.
Use w...
skill.author: 92Bilal26

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for image generation workflow. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access detected. Safe for marketplace.

content.value_statement: Creating professional diagrams for lessons takes hours of design work. This skill provides a structured workflow to generate teaching visuals using Gemini 3 with browser automation and 6-gate quality control.
actual_capabilities: Generate educational illustrations using Gemini 3 through browser automation
Apply 6-gate quality control (spelling, layout, color, typography, teaching value, uniqueness)
Create batch image workflows with autonomous multi-turn iteration
Convert creative briefs into visual assets following structured methodology
Produce diagrams optimized for target audience proficiency levels
limitations: Requires browser-use skill and active browser session
Does not generate photorealistic images or stock photography
Cannot edit existing images - creates new visuals only
Depends on Gemini 3 availability and rate limits

use_cases.title: Lesson Illustration Pipeline
use_cases.description: Generate all chapter visuals for a course in batch mode with consistent quality and branding.

use_cases.title: Concept Diagram Automation
use_cases.description: Create architecture diagrams, process flows, and system visualizations from structured creative briefs.

use_cases.title: Visual Asset Workflow
use_cases.description: Integrate Gemini-generated visuals into learning applications with organized file structure.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Diagram Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a teaching diagram showing [conceptexplained]. Include a clear title, 3 key points, and use blue for main concepts and green for supporting details.

prompt_templates.title: Process Flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a horizontal flow diagram for [processname] with 5 steps. Use hex color #2563eb for the main pathway and include icons for each step.

prompt_templates.title: Comparison Chart
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a comparison visual showing [conceptA] vs [conceptB]. Use a split layout with #2563eb on left and #10b981 on right. Largest text = key difference.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 4 educational images for this lesson. For each: NEW CHAT, paste the attached brief, wait 35s, verify 6 gates, iterate max 3 times, then download. Report completion only.

output_examples.input: Generate a diagram showing how a web request flows through a load balancer to backend servers. Target audience is B1 intermediate learners.
output: A horizontal flow diagram appears in Gemini
User waits 35 seconds for image generation
User verifies: spelling correct, layout shows 3 servers in proper proportion, brand blue (#2563eb) used, key insight text is largest, concept grasp under 10 seconds, unique design
If any gate fails, user provides principle-based feedback
Once all gates pass, user downloads full-size image to lesson folder

best_practices: Always use the creative brief format (Story, Emotional Intent, Visual Metaphor, Subject, Colors, Typography) for reasoning activation
Create a new Gemini chat for each visual to avoid context contamination between images
Verify all 6 quality gates before downloading - never accept first output without inspection
anti_patterns: Converting creative briefs to pixel specifications defeats reasoning activation
Asking for permission between batch items breaks autonomous workflow
Reusing the same chat session for multiple visuals causes context contamination

faq.question: Which AI models does this skill support?
faq.answer: Designed for Gemini 3 image generation. Requires browser-use skill to automate navigation to gemini.google.com.

faq.question: What image formats are supported?
faq.answer: Gemini generates PNG/JPG images. Download as full-size files and embed directly into markdown lessons.

faq.question: How many images can I generate in batch mode?
faq.answer: No hard limit. For 8+ images, condense briefs to 80 tokens while keeping story, intent, colors, and reasoning elements.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external services?
faq.answer: Image prompts are sent to Google Gemini. No other data collection. Review Gemini privacy policy for details.

faq.question: What if images fail quality gates repeatedly?
faq.answer: Maximum 3 iteration attempts per gate. After 3 failures, defer the visual and continue batch. Document deferred items in checkpoint.

faq.question: How does this compare to DALL-E or Midjourney?
faq.answer: Optimized for educational diagrams with reasoning-focused prompts. Less suited for artistic or photorealistic imagery. Best for structured teaching visuals.
